data.title: Good Food, Average Service
data.text: My wife and I recently moved to South Jordan and we recently tried Saffron Valley. The restaurant is very small, but very clean. It was a Tuesday, so there was a buffet option which we did not choose. We instead tried the Chicken Tikka Masala and Naan. The food was definitely good, but we both felt that Royal India in Sandy is still the best in town. We will likely drive a little further next time.

data.title: Excellent Choice for Indian!
data.text: I loved this place! I adore Indian food so when we found this little restaurant advertising Indian 'Street Food' we had to stop in and check it out. We did have to wait about 15 to 20 minutes after ordering to receive our food (note to self: street food doesn't equate to fast food), but it was definitely worth the wait. Sounds cliché, but it honestly was like an explosion of flavor in my mouth! I had the chicken tikka dosa and amazing spicy lentil soup, my companion had the Indo-Chinese chili style chicken (spicy)! :) I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys Indian food and wants to try a new twist.

data.title: Great Indian food in a simple setting
data.text: We are regular customers of Saffron Valley.  The food is great,the staff are friendly and helpful and the simple, clean decor does not detract from the experience.

data.title: Best Indian in SLC hands-down!
data.text: This place blew me away.  Its all authentic, they have a huge menu and everything we ate was wonderful!

data.title: Small dinner
data.text: Visited the restaurant after the movie and thought of having light dinner. Just ordered the katti roll. It comes with Salad and soup. The salad and roll are good and comes to soup, its nothing but sambar added with coconut :)

data.title: Awesome Authenticated Indian Food
data.text: If you want to try Indian cuisine, go for this. Tasty, awesome authenticated Indian Food. Good service.

data.title: Stupendous
data.text: We have been living in Utah for almost three years. I think Saffron Valley is the best restaurant we have tried so far.  Every dish is a joy. Although I  am not a vegetarian, I frequently pick the vegetables there because they are done so well! The prices are great, the portions are large, and the service is perfect. If you don't want your food too spicy, speak up. We love the wraps, the dosas, and they do the best mango lassi. A bargain.

data.title: Decent Indian food
data.text: Saffron Valley has a decent Indian food buffet. If you want quick and easy Indian food and it is close by then this is a good place to go. Its not a place I would go out of the way to eat at.

data.title: Really great food!!!
data.text: Great choices and flavors!  Got really busy and service slowed down-naturally, but we loved the authenticity!  Just moved here from sugar house and it will be our go to Indian restaurant!

data.title: Average Indian cuisine
data.text:
I went there because somebody highly recommended it.
I am not very impressed with the food in this place.

data.title: Best Indian food in town!
data.text: We have visited Saffron Valley many times over the last year and have fallen in love with this wonderful little Imdian restaurant. The food is great and the service is as well.

data.title: Love it!
data.text: Admittedly, I am a novice re Indian cuisine--but this place is delicious. Love the coconut shrimp and pineapple lassi. Also--I've been wanting to taste samosas since I've read about them in Jhumpa Lahiri's books--very good (potato-filled hors d'oeuvres) but if I ate enough, I'd sink a ship. Liked it so much, we went twice in a week. Service is very good, too--attentive and willing to explain anything. If you're up for it: they offer cooking classes as well. Sounds like fun.

data.title: Delectable Indian Street Food
data.text: This is our favorite Indian restaurant in the valley. We try something different each time, and have never been disappointed. The Tikka Masala is our favorite! I have no idea how authentic this food is, but it is all delicious. The prices are very reasonable and easy to handle with a family. The only complaint would be that the location is very small and is getting very popular, so it is sometimes hard to find seating. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Love this restaurant.

data.title: The food is simple and good
data.text: The food was good. We ordered Vegetarian and Non-Veg. The Naan's and curry are good. Please don't go for Vada.

data.title: Excellent customer service, amazing food
data.text: My husband and I discovered Saffron Valley earlier this year and have yet to find a better Indian restaurant. I placed an online order tonight and showed up to pick it up only to find I had ordered for the salt lake location and not the south Jordan. The gentleman at the register was kind enough to make me my order at the south Jordan location so I didn't have to drive 25 minutes to pick up from salt lake. Excellent customer service, excellent food.

data.title: Perfect place for take out!
data.text: These guys are fantastic.   Service is friendly and prompt.   We had the coconut Curry and wow perfect.  When a place a pick up order it's always correct.   I have not tried the buffet yet, but it looked really good.

data.title: Surprisingly Superior Indian Food at Saffron Valley in South Jordan, UT
data.text: We're pretty familiar with Indian street food and have eaten it for years.  We ordered samosas [fried pastry with savory potato filling], masala dosa [huge thin pancake with savory potato stuffing wrapped in it], and Gulab Jamin [fried milk balls with sweet rosewater syrup].  Every one of these dishes were delicious.  The place is clean and the service attentive.  It's a small place with a seating capacity of 42 people.  The food is good enough to make this place worth your visit.  The menu is wide with clay over kabobs, Indian wraps [Kati rolls], curries, famous street foods, savory crepes, stuffed flatbreads [parathas], hearty Biryanbis [rice dishes], Indo Chinese choices, children's choices, desserts, frappes, hot chocolates and steamers, and shakes and floats.  My only objection is the music is a bit loud for me, but that's not a reason to pass this wonderful place up.  Parking isn't too much of a problem.  .

data.title: Less Meat More Gravy
data.text: I have used Saffron Valley a number of times to cater a gathering for me and my family and unfortunately the gentlemen who has taken my orders I think is the owner who had constantly decreases the meat portion to the point there is maybe a spoonful of meat in his sauces. For the price it is not a good value!

data.title: Good Choice
data.text: Exotic yet accessible, this small bistro provides a taste of India in the heart of the Salt Lake valley. It is small but efficient, and seemed to feed a large number of locals during our brief stop. Attentive waitstaff helped identify the dishes on the small buffet, and, of course, I tried them all. Great flavors and textures were the result.

data.title: Great food but little pricey
data.text: We went to this locations couple of times and we liked the food, service and ambience. The variety of menu is good. Food tasted great. Only thing i didn't like is Price. It is an indian fast food restaurant and the prices were way higher than california, new york which is hard to believe. The quantity was not justifiable to the price. If you are in a group of 2-4 people, you can afford it but it will be too much expensive for the group of more than 6 people.
